Subject: Brains, Sex, and Machine Learning - New Geoff Hinton Tech Talk
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770077; y=CLnDfZn3mycHtzA3jwt10qU2egu7J_y36-BFgY1wWCJltnoWAAHe

Hi,

FYI in case you haven't come across this yet, Geoff Hinton gave
another Tech Talk in June this year which I can strongly recommend...

    [Brains, Sex, and Machine Learning]
    http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DleXA5ADG78

There is some fascinating stuff in there about co-adaptation of
neurons and how it relates to sexual reproduction, and how biological
neurons communicate digitally rather than with real/analogue values.
To the NEAT folks, you'll just have to take my word for it that I've
just come across this as I was making a vague argument for ensembles
of neural nets and co-adaptation just recently.

As an aside, I came across the video from a post to the machine
learning sub-reddit, which you may also be interested in...

   http://www.reddit.com/r/MachineLearning/
   http://www.reddit.com/r/MachineLearning/comments/zzir6/what_is_your_favorite_machine_learning_lecture_on/

Regards,

Colin.
